title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When performing the 'Revert' action in the java editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file.
EB: This seems odd, as the 'Revert' action should not take longer than closing and reopening the file.
SR: 1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 2) Mark the file as dirty by selecting the end of the first line and adding a space character. 3) Click on the close box in the editor tab, choose 'no' when prompted to save changes, and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. Compare the time it takes for this process. 4) Repeat steps 1) and 2), and instead of closing and reopening the file, select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. Compare the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original file.
